name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
method: Rinse quinoa under cold water and drain.
In a medium saucepan, combine quinoa with 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer until quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes.
Let quinoa cool to room temperature, then fluff with a fork.
In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa, black beans, corn, red bell pepper, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, and salt.
Pour dressing over quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator until serving.
description: A fresh and zesty salad perfect for a nutritious lunch. Packed with protein from quinoa and black beans.

name: Chicken and Vegetable Stir-Fry
method: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, cornstarch, and water. Set aside.
In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add broccoli, carrots, and red bell pepper to the skillet. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp, about 5 minutes.
Pour sauce over chicken and vegetables. Cook until sauce thickens, about 2 minutes.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.
description: A quick and easy stir-fry that's perfect for a  healthy dinner. Packed with lean protein and colorful vegetables.

name: Banana Oat Pancakes
method: In a blender, combine bananas, eggs, oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Blend until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add butter.
Pour pancake batter onto the skillet to form pancakes of desired size.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancakes, then flip and cook until golden brown.
description: A healthy and delicious breakfast option that's gluten-free and dairy-free. Perfect for a lazy weekend morning.
